messages.content:
Categorize this IT Ticket:

change project wrong approval flow wednesday pm please review annual leave pm hello please redirect supporting changed code approve annual leave requests going forward find way change myself kind regards head ext pm re please review annual leave pm off approve holidays thank galaxy date please review annual leave pm has requested annual leave working days please review annual leave allowance details days allowed days taken days remaining amount annual leave requested give balance remaining days exceed days required by selecting accept decline option accept database updated information decline rejection reason requestor regards guide rejecting messages tab link located top left side screen select requests menu option double pending view form button view details modified marked red asterisk hold mouse over asterisk enter comments comments authorize by pressing accept decline buttons technical issues please

message.reasoning:
**Categorizing IT Ticket**

I need to categorize an IT ticket based on its content. It discusses annual leave approvals, holiday requests, and other HR-related management software issues. The relevant terms include "review annual leave," "approve holidays," and "accept decline option." Since the content centers around HR support, the best-fitting category is "HR Support." Even though the specific term "HR" isn't listed, "HR Support" is one of the options. So, I will respond with the JSON category: HR Support.**Formatting IT Ticket Response**

The prompt asks me to categorize an IT ticket and return the response in JSON format, specifically needing the "category" property. The required output should be {"category":"HR Support"}. I should ensure that "HR Support" is properly capitalized to match the enumerated options exactly. Even though I might want to provide some rationale, the instruction says to respond with the JSON only. So, I'll stick to just that and return nothing else.
